intro: Psychotria chlorantha, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary or the sacred plant of the Yoruba people, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and typically reaches a height of about 30 cm. Psychotria chlorantha is also noted for its traditional use in religious and medicinal practices among various indigenous communities.
